==Definition==
Inappropriate prescribing refers to prescribing that creates more risks than benefits for the patient.

Inappropriateness may relate to :

*Prescribing without a clinical indication, not complying with the marketing authorisation (MA) or the official recommendations of learned societies.
*Failure to take into account the patient's characteristics when choosing the active ingredient, dose, galenic form or route of administration of the drug: age, weight, co-morbidities (chronic renal failure, hepatocellular insufficiency, etc.), pregnancy, breast-feeding, for example.
*Failure to take account of potential drug interactions.

question.title: What is inappropriate prescribing of medicines (PMI)?
question.description: A multiple-choice question about the definition of PMI

option_a.title: Prescribing without a clinical indication or ignoring official recommendations
option_a.description: A plausible but incorrect option that is closely related to the definition of PMI

option_b.title: Taking into account the patient's characteristics when choosing the active ingredient, dose, galenic form or route of administration
option_b.description: A plausible but incorrect option that is related to PMI, but not the definition

option_c.title: Failure to take into account potential drug interactions
option_c.description: A correct option that is part of the definition of PMI

option_d.title: Prescribing without a clinical indication or ignoring official recommendations, and taking into account the patient's characteristics
option_d.description: An incorrect option that combines two aspects of PMI, making it plausible but incorrect

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct option that represents the definition of PMI
